Key Match Events: Jofra Archer, Mark Wood and Chris Jordan ambushed India with blistering pace and trampoline bounce, taking the two-paced Ahmedabad track out of the equation
India could only get to 124 for 7 in the first T20I
England stormed to 50 for 0 in their powerplay in the chase
Jason Roy and Jos Buttler repeatedly mowed India's depleted attack to the boundary

KL Rahul dragged a 141kph dart from Archer back onto his stumps for 1 and then Kohli backed away first ball to Adil Rashid, who had taken the new ball for England, swishing him in the air to mid-off for a duck
Iyer tried his best to give India's bowlers something to defend, but that soon became next to nothing
Malan and Johnny Bairstow took them home by batting at a similar high gear
Wood set the pulse racing by breaching 150kph
Archer returned at the death to get Hardik Pandya and Shardul Thakur off consecutive deliveries
Iyer brought up his third T20I half-century
Roy took Chahal for 26 off 13 balls
Buttler, too, joined the fun, dashing out of the crease and swiping Patel over midwicket for six
Malan and Bairstow rushed England to a 1-0 lead
Pre-Game Insights: India had packed their attack with three spinners - legspinner Yuzvendra Chahal and fingerspin-bowling allrounders Axar Patel and Washington Sundar
England went the other way, recalling Wood, at the expense of allrounder Tom Curran, and pairing him up with Archer and Jordan
Post-Match Reflections: Ian Bell: Jofra Archer is 'a real entertainer' when he bowls like this

Miscellaneous Highlights: England won by 8 wickets (with 27 balls remaining)
Jofra Archer, Mark Wood, Chris Jordan hit straps as England canter to victory
Shreyas Iyer's 67 in vain as India could only get to 124 for 7 in the first T20I

The team ended a 20-year championship drought
This was the 100th meeting between the two teams
